page.title: 09Scotton/Northorpe: Transport
page.content: The majority of families own a car (a lot are 2-car families), as there is very little public transport left. Scotton is on the Gainsborough- Scunthorpe bus route, with 6 buses in each direction on weekdays; there is no Sunday service. The timing of the buses is not always convenient (no bus from Gainsborough between 10.35 am and 4.10 pm, last through bus leaves Gainsborough at 6.45 pm, Scunthorpe 5.40 pm). There is no public transport to or from Northorpe, the County Council provide school buses for children going to Scotter, Gains- borough and Kirton Lindsey. Northorpe was on the main railway route from Grimsby to Manchester, with Northorpe station (now closed) particularly busy for goods. A victim of the Beeching cuts in the mid 1950s the line is now reduced to a single track (goods only)
